physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The proband developed transient, mild hypoglycemia within the first 36 hours of life and was diagnosed with central congenital hypothyroidism. Magnetic resonance imaging of the brain revealed a small anterior pituitary, ectopic posterior pituitary, and a thin, interrupted pituitary stalk.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Height was in the 25th to 50th percentile until age 16 to 18 months, after which there was little gain in length, resulting in height being below the first percentile by age 2 years and 8 months. Initial growth hormone status was normal, but recombinant human growth hormone therapy was initiated at age 2 years and 9 months due to lack of statural growth. After 15 months of therapy, height increased to the 38th percentile.
